p: B. cinerea is much less sensitive to essential oil antimicrobial activity [ 40]. In our experiments, the fungus confirmed to be less sensitive to EO vapors, compared to M. fructicola and maximum reduction of conidial germination was 40.1% for savory vapors at 10%. Germ tube length of B. cinerea growth was inhibited only by 10% thyme treatment, while the other treatments were not statistically different from the untreated control.
